required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial To Evaluate ANT-1207 In Participants With Primary Axillary Hyperhidrosis
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial to Evaluate ANT-1207 in the Treatment of Primary Axillary Hyperhidrosis in Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to establish the therapeutic range of ANT-1207 in the treatment of primary axillary hyperhidrosis.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Both a Change From Baseline in Hyperhidrosis Disease Severity Scale (HDSS) Score by ≥ 2 Points and a Change From Baseline in Gravimetric Sweat Production (GSP) by ≥ 50%
primary_outcome.description: The HDSS is a patient completed scale that measures how excessive sweating effects quality of life using a 4-point scale where: 1=My underarm sweating is not noticeable and never interferes with my daily activities to 4= My underarm sweating is intolerable and always interferes with my daily activities. GSP was measured using a pre-weighed filter paper placed into the axilla area (armpit) to collect sweat over a 5-minute period. The paper was removed and weighed to determine the amount of sweat produced. The HDSS and the GSP were assessed at Baseline and Week 12. The change from Baseline was calculated. The percentage of participants who had both a change (reduction) from Baseline in HDSS score by ≥ 2 points and a change (reduction) from Baseline in GSP by ≥ 50% is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hyperhidrosis Disease Severity Scale (HDSS) Score Change From Baseline ≥ 2 Points
secondary_outcome.description: The HDSS is a patient completed scale that measures how excessive sweating effects quality of life using a 4-point scale where: 1=My underarm sweating is not noticeable and never interferes with my daily activities to 4= My underarm sweating is intolerable and always interferes with my daily activities. The change from Baseline was calculated. The percentage of participants who had a change (reduction) from Baseline in HDSS score by ≥ 2 points is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Gravimetric Sweat Production (GSP) Change From Baseline ≥ 50%
secondary_outcome.description: GSP was measured using a pre-weighed filter paper placed into the axilla area (armpit) to collect sweat over a 5-minute period. The paper was removed and weighed to determine the amount of sweat produced. The change from Baseline was calculated. The percentage of participants who had a change (reduction) from Baseline in GSP by ≥ 50% is reported.

arm_group.description: Vehicle for botulinum toxin Type A topical liniment (ANT-1207) applied topically in a volume of 12 drops per axilla (armpit) once on Day 0.
Botulinum toxin Type A topical liniment (ANT-1207) Dose 1 (lowest dose) applied topically in a volume of 12 drops per axilla (armpit) once on Day 0.
Botulinum toxin Type A topical liniment (ANT-1207) Dose 2 (second lowest dose) applied topically in a volume of 12 drops per axilla (armpit) once on Day 0.
Botulinum toxin Type A topical liniment (ANT-1207) Dose 3 (mid-level dose) applied topically in a volume of 12 drops per axilla (armpit) once on Day 0.
Botulinum toxin Type A topical liniment (ANT-1207) Dose 4 (second highest dose) applied topically in a volume of 12 drops per axilla (armpit) once on Day 0.
Botulinum toxin Type A topical liniment (ANT-1207) Dose 5 (highest dose) applied topically in a volume of 12 drops per axilla (armpit) once on Day 0.

intervention.description: Vehicle for ANT-1207 liniment formulation without active ingredient.
Botulinum toxin Type A topical liniment (ANT-1207).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ages 18 - 70 years of age
- diagnosis of primary axillary hyperhidrosis
- HDSS score of ≥3
- threshold sweat production/axilla in 5 minutes as measured gravimetrically
- willingness to shave underarms prior to each study visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- botulinum toxin treatment in the prior 6 months
- signs of infection in the axilla
- skin affliction in the axilla requiring medical treatment
- oral anticholinergic treatment
- use of antiperspirants, deodorants, powders, or lotions
- use of axillary depilatories or axillary epilation
- history of surgery or other interventions for axillary hyperhidrosis
- female subjects who are pregnant or are nursing a child

facility.name: Research Institute of the Southeast, LLC
Lupo Center for Aesthetic & General Dermatology
Dermatology and Laser Center of Charleston, PA

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Both a Change From Baseline in Hyperhidrosis Disease Severity Scale (HDSS) Score by ≥ 2 Points and a Change From Baseline in Gravimetric Sweat Production (GSP) by ≥ 50%
outcome.description: The HDSS is a patient completed scale that measures how excessive sweating effects quality of life using a 4-point scale where: 1=My underarm sweating is not noticeable and never interferes with my daily activities to 4= My underarm sweating is intolerable and always interferes with my daily activities. GSP was measured using a pre-weighed filter paper placed into the axilla area (armpit) to collect sweat over a 5-minute period. The paper was removed and weighed to determine the amount of sweat produced. The HDSS and the GSP were assessed at Baseline and Week 12. The change from Baseline was calculated. The percentage of participants who had both a change (reduction) from Baseline in HDSS score by ≥ 2 points and a change (reduction) from Baseline in GSP by ≥ 50% is reported.
outcome.population: Modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) population was defined as all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of investigational product with both a baseline value and ≥ 1 value during the double-blind treatment period. Missing values were imputed using the last observation carried forward (LOCF) approach.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
